A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Honestly the worst movie yet. It makes 1-3 look decent with at least their own plot line that keeps you interested. You amost literally get to watch two main scenes for the almost 3 hours of your life you lost. First one is a space ship running out of fuel\, being chased by an Empire fleet which\, despite their top technology\, can't catch up. The next is Ray and Luke walking up and down a mountain arguing about who and what cause the Jedi to decline which all becomes mute after about 2 hours cause it all ends anyway\, with Luke feeling sorry for himself. Worst of all\, questions which were sparked in the initial sub par re-boot go almost totally under the radar despite significant plot characters dying. Toss in a dose of stupid Disney humour and you got yourself the last Jedi. 3h of accomplishing nothing until the last 10 minutes when what we already know\, she becomes a Jedi. Save your time and money.
